notes: This file captures the rule-based Tibetan lunar calendar observances hard-coded in PracticeDatesService.getPractices().

Rules reference Tibetan month/day plus flags used by the app: monthFlag (0 normal, 1 first of doubled month, 2 repeated second month) and doubleDayFlag (1 first of doubled day, 2 second/repeated day).
The app generally omits practices on the FIRST day of a doubled day (doubleDayFlag==1), expecting them to be observed on the second day.
The app also moves practices for skipped Tibetan day numbers onto the previous Gregorian date; this JSON does not enumerate those per-year shifts, only the underlying rule triggers.

monthFlag.1: first occurrence of a doubled month
monthFlag.2: repeated (second) occurrence of a doubled month

doubleDayFlag.1: first occurrence of a doubled day (practices typically skipped)

importantCelebratoryDates.name: Dalai Lama Birthday
importantCelebratoryDates.description: The 6th of July is the birthday of His Holiness the 14th Dalai Lama.

importantCelebratoryDates.name: Tibetan New Year
importantCelebratoryDates.description: Beginning of new Tibetan year. During the first fifteen days, fifteen 'Miracle Days' are celebrated which commemorate fifteen miracles that the Buddha is said to have performed.

importantCelebratoryDates.name: Day of Miracles (Chötrul Düchen)
importantCelebratoryDates.description: The fifteenth day of a new Tibetan year is the culmination of the fifteen 'Miracle Days' which commemorate fifteen miracles that the Buddha is said to have performed. The Day of Miracles is one of four important Tibetan holidays related to the Buddha.

alsoAdds.name: Precepts
alsoAdds.description: Buddha days and eclipses are considered to be particularly powerful days for taking the Eight Mahayana Precepts.

importantCelebratoryDates.name: Buddha's Birth, Enlightenment and Paranirvana (Saka Dawa Düchen)
importantCelebratoryDates.description: Celebration of the Buddha's birth, enlightenment and paranirvana (Saka Dawa Düchen). Saka Dawa is one of four important Tibetan holidays related to the Buddha.

importantCelebratoryDates.name: Buddha's first teaching (Chökhor Düchen)
importantCelebratoryDates.description: Celebration of Buddha's first 'turning of the wheel of Dharma' (Chökhor Düchen). On this day the first teaching of the Buddha is celebrated. Chökhor Düchen is one of four important Tibetan holidays related to the Buddha.

alsoAdds.name: Precepts
alsoAdds.description: Buddha days and eclipses are considered to be particularly powerful days for taking the Eight Mahayana Precepts.

importantCelebratoryDates.name: Buddha's descent from Tushita (Lhabab Düchen)
importantCelebratoryDates.description: Celebration of Buddha's descent from the god realm of Tushita (Lhabab Düchen) after the Buddha had taught the Dharma to his mother there. Lhabab Düchen is one of four important Tibetan holidays related to the Buddha.

alsoAdds.name: Precepts
alsoAdds.description: Buddha days and eclipses are considered to be particularly powerful days for taking the Eight Mahayana Precepts.

importantCelebratoryDates.name: Je Tsongkhapa Day (Ganden Ngamchö)
importantCelebratoryDates.description: On the 25th day of 10th Tibetan lunar month the parinivarna of Je Tsongkhapa is commemorated.

importantCelebratoryDates.name: Guru Rinpoche Universal Prayer Day (Dzamling Chi Sang / Universal Incense Day)
importantCelebratoryDates.description: On the 15th day of the 5th Tibetan lunar month the taming of local Tibetan deities by Padmasambhava and the founding of Samye Monastery, the first Buddhist Monastery in Tibet, are celebrated.

practices.name: Precepts

practices.name: Tsog
practices.description: Tsog offering (Daka Tsog). The tenth day of each Tibetan month is one of the two days each month when Tsog offerings should be performed.

specialCases.descriptionOverride: Tsog offering (Daka Tsog). The tenth day of each Tibetan month is one of the two days each month when Tsog offerings should be performed. The Tsog offering on the 10th day of the 12th Tibetan month is considered to be one of the two most important Tsog days of the entire year. (In some years month 12 may be doubled; the source app adds a warning text in that case.)

practices.name: Full Moon
